key_title: Key to the species of Trifolium

Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the subfamilies of Fabaceae
Key to the genera of Fabaceae subfam. Faboideae

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Fabaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Jeanes, J.A. (1996). Fabaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Corolla yellow; leaves with terminal petiolule usually distinctly longer than laterals (equal in rare T. aureum)
Corolla red, pink, cream or white; leaves with all petiolules more or less equal
Leaflets equally petiolulate; corolla 6–7 mm long
Central leaflet with petiolule distinctly longer than those of lateral leaflets (at least on upper leaves); corolla 3–6 mm long
Inflorescence globose, 30–50-flowered; flowers imbricate; standard limb orbicular, grooved, hooded over keel in pod
Inflorescence hemispherical, 3–20-flowered; flowers not imbricate; standard limb ovate, scarcely grooved, not hooded over keel in pod
Inflorescence with all flowers fertile
Inflorescence with 1–6 fertile flowers (with petals) and many infertile flowers (without petals)
Calyx tube conspicuously inflated, bladdery in fruit
Calyx tube not inflated and bladdery in fruit
Flowers non-resupinate (standard uppermost); corolla persistent in fruit
Flowers resupinate (standard lowermost); corolla not persistent in fruit
Plant perennial, prostrate or tufted; leaflet margins minutely toothed; inflorescence to 20 mm long; corolla less than 10 mm long
Plant annual, upright; leaflet margins prominently toothed; inflorescence more than 20 mm long; corolla more than 10 mm long
Peduncles usually longer than subtending leaves; inflorescence globose; calyx throat glabrous, teeth spiny, upper teeth conspicuous in pod
Peduncles shorter than subtending leaves; inflorescence umbellate; calyx throat with a ring of hairs, teeth blunt, upper teeth obscure in pod
Leaflets of upper leaves lanceolate, linear-oblong or linear, 5–15 times as long as wide
Leaflets of upper leaves not as above, less than 4 times as long as wide
Leaflets of upper leaves lanceolate; inflorescence 30–80 mm long, usually terminal; peduncles shorter than subtending leaves; calyx tube as long as teeth; corolla not or scarcely exceeding calyx

Leaflets of upper leaves linear to linear-oblong; inflorescence 10–20 mm long, axillary or terminal; peduncles longer than subtending leaves; calyx tube much shorter than teeth; corolla shorter than calyx
Inflorescence 1–10-flowered, pedunculate
Inflorescence usually more than 10-flowered, if fewer-flowered, then inflorescence sessile
Leaflets oblanceolate to obovate; calyx teeth not spreading stellately at maturity; pod 2–9-seeded, distinctly exserted from calyx tube
Leaflets obcordate; calyx teeth spreading stellately at maturity, forming large, bristly heads; pod 1-seeded, included in calyx tube
Inflorescence sessile or peduncles shorter than subtending leaves
Peduncles equal to or longer than subtending leaves
Margins of leaflets almost entire
Margins of leaflets variously toothed
Plant completely glabrous or with a few hairs on calyx and bases of leaflets
Plant hairy
Pedicels c. 2 mm long; calyx teeth erect in pod; pod exserted from calyx tube, 3–4 mm long
Pedicel to 1.5 mm long; calyx teeth spreading or recurved in pod; pod included in calyx tube, 2–3 mm long
Inflorescences remote, mostly more than 20-flowered, not obscured by the stipules; corolla pink, longer than calyx
Inflorescences close together, 1–15-flowered, often clustered near base of plant, largely obscured by the broad membranous stipules; corolla white, shorter than calyx
Inflorescence clasped by 3 broad-ovate to orbicular involucral stipules; calyx tube 20-veined, teeth blunt; corolla more than 10 mm long, purple
Inflorescence not as above; calyx tube 10-veined, teeth spiny; corolla less than 10 mm long, white or pink

Leaflets with lateral veins mostly recurved and thickened towards the margins; calyx tube throat narrowed by an annular thickening in fruit, lower tooth recurved, others spreading or erect in pod; corolla white
Leaflets with lateral veins mostly straight, not thickened near margins; calyx tube throat open, ciliate, teeth all erect in pod; corolla pink
Plant moderately hairy; inflorescence elongated, ovate or cylindrical; corolla usually red to purple (rarely cream)
Plant sparsely hairy or glabrescent, if ever moderately hairy than inflorescence a globose head; corolla pink, cream or white
Plant creeping, rooting freely at nodes
Plant erect, decumbent or ascending, never rooting at nodes
Flowers sessile or subsessile; pod included in calyx, usually 1-seeded
Flowers pedicellate; pod exserted from calyx tube, 1–4-seeded
Leaflets minutely dentate; corolla of similar length to calyx; calyx 20-veined, glabrous; calyx lobes 3- or 5-veined at base

Leaflets entire or minutely dentate; corolla significantly longer than calyx (similar in length to calyx in T. leuchantum); calyx 10-veined, sometimes obscured by hairs; calyx lobes 1- or 3-veined at base
Corolla significantly longer than calyx; calyx lobes unequal
Corolla of similar length to calyx; calyx lobes subequal
Plant perennial; leaflets entire or minutely serrate; inflorescence mostly 10–20-flowered; calyx teeth unequal; pod 2–4-seeded
Plant annual; leaflets dentate; inflorescence mostly more than 20-flowered; calyx teeth almost equal; pod 1–2-seeded
Prostrate or decumbent annuals; fruiting heads deflexed, subterranean; fertile flowers 2–6; sterile flowers with a wiry calyx
Erect annuals; fruiting head not subterranean; fertile flowers 1 or 2; sterile flowers densely plumose
